In this section, we explore the consequences for the mitigation policy of assuming different potential future populations and social objectives (TU vs. AU). We take our population projections from the 2015 revision of the United Nations (UN)-medium, -low, and -high population scenarios ( 30) as well as a more extreme (“Ultralow”) case based on Basten et al. ( 31) ( Fig. 1 A ). Although we retain the names of the UN projections, we have modified them by extending them beyond 2100, when they end (
Materials and Methods ).
